clipboard_content:
Joel Borellis
www.linkedin.com/in/joelborellis (LinkedIn)
joelborellis@outlook.com (email)
415-378-1502 (cell)
Austin, TX 78734
 
Summary 
 
Experienced Technology leader for enterprises and small businesses.  I have led the strategy and execution of transformative business development programs for the largest technology companies.  I am enthusiastic about growing AI technology adoption by engaging technical leaders, influencers and line of business managers.  I have an L400 understanding of AI technology trends and the emerging start-up ecosystem.  I am most proud of the many profitable partnerships I have helped build and nurture, and the successful partnership programs I have helped deliver for several Fortune 100 companies.
 
Professional Experience 
 
January 2024 – Present 
Director, AI Sales and Technical Enablement, Microsoft
•	Responsible for leading and empowering a specialist sales and technical team consisting of deep subject matter experts on Artificial Intelligence technologies in Microsoft Azure. Our team helps major enterprises plan, build, implement and adopt advanced, secure and responsible artificial intelligence capabilities including Machine Learning, Cognitive Services, and Knowledge Mining scenarios across the cloud and the edge.

October 2021 – January 2024 
President – gametolearn, LLC
•	Founded a small business focused on helping educators better use gaming and Generative AI technologies to achieve better outcomes with their classroom curriculum.
•	Consult small businesses on OpenAI projects to help them achieve positive business outcomes using Generative AI technologies.

December 2020 – September 2021 
Senior Manager – Solution Architecture, Amazon Web Services
•	Led customer and partner facing solution architect teams including specialized technical architects for Microsoft, SAP, VMWare, IBM and Oracle workloads running on AWS.
•	Accountable for delivering partner originated sales wins and design wins for the strategic account workloads on AWS.

April 2019 – June 2020 
Principal Software Engineer – Commercial Software Engineering, Microsoft
•	Led customer and partner engineering engagements around Microsoft's cloud technologies with focus in Education including research institutions, K-12 and Higher Education.
•	Assisted educational institutions with their transformation of IT to modern and digital platforms.

July 2017 – April 2019 
One Commercial Partner Technical Sales Enablement Director, Microsoft 
•	Led Microsoft’s global One Commercial Partner technical team and set the direction of the partner enablement strategy and execution.  Created and delivered technical role success plans for Microsoft technical strategists and architects supporting the global partner ecosystem. Led technical architect engagement with Microsoft’s top strategic partners.
•	Accountable for delivering creative skills development initiatives, role execution guidance and technical partner plans for developing cloud offerings associated with global cloud consumption revenue goals. 
 





January 2016 – July 2017 
General Manager, US Partner Enablement, Microsoft 
•	Led Microsoft’s US Partner Development Unit teams.  Delivered the strategy and execution of the partner enablement programs and cloud solution building initiatives including managing the teams’ helping partners build cloud offerings and practices resulting in increased partner capabilities 
•	Accountable for delivering the required partner solutions capacity and capability to deliver the US Subsidiary cloud consumption revenue goals. 

June 2007 – January 2016 
Group Vice President, Worldwide Partner Enablement and Communications, Oracle 
•	Led Oracle’s Worldwide Partner Enablement team.  Led the development of partners capabilities to sell and implement Oracle products and solutions profitably across multiple channels and in mass scale, and for creating innovative framework and standards which allow for Oracle to define and measure partners skills and competencies across all product lines.
•	Served as Oracle Executive spokesperson to analysts and press for all partner related communications. 
•	Accountable for growth in partner capabilities supporting global consumption revenue goals, and for increasing partner loyalty to Oracle via communications and marketing programs and events. 
•	Led Oracle’s worldwide Technical Account Management team.  Established and developed sales enablement programs for global distributors and strategic partners.  Executed pipeline management, forecasting and closing opportunities through global distributors and key partners.
•	Hired, trained, and managed a team of technical account managers supporting partners sales.
•	Accountable for sales through enablement of and management of Oracle partners across established and emerging technologies.

September 2002 – June 2007 
Director, Global Platforms and Distribution Alliances, Oracle 
•	Recreated Oracle’s partnership with Dell resulting in the largest reseller by revenue.  Responsible for pipeline management, forecasting and closing opportunities through strategic partners.  Worked closely with executive management within Oracle and their partners, directly negotiating contracts and identifying key partnership sales opportunities.  Led teams in technical integration efforts between Oracle and partners.
 
June 1998 – September 2002 
Senior Software Engineer – Applications Engineering, Blue Martini Software 
•	Developed key product capabilities for Blue Martini’s retail applications.  Focused development on integration with other packaged applications and legacy application architectures. 
•	Worked onsite with customers to maximize their software purchase and customize options for their business requirements.
•	Instrumental part of product launch team for first version of Blue Martini Platform at large retail client.  Fielded the first implementations of Blue Martini’s premier product suite to major customers.
•	Designed and implemented integrations between Blue Martini and existing legacy systems including developing re-useable platform for passing data to and from Blue Martini application.
 
Volunteer and Projects 
 
•	Board Chair - Ability Experience – Non-profit organization benefiting individuals with disabilities.
•	EduCel, LLC - Serve as technical adviser to the EduCel, LLC board.
•	Shadow Seller – Chief architect and developer on GenAI sales platform 

Education 

Bachelor of Arts in Political Science, 1992 
University of South Carolina, Columbia, South Carolina 
 
Master of Science – Technology Commercialization, 2023
University of Texas, Austin
